newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares rise, further gains expected.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares rise, further gains expected.

text.p: Slovenian shares rose 1.65 percent on Monday, the year's last trading day, as a result of book balancing and traders said the uptrend was likely to continue next year.
The 10-share SBI index rose 19.19 points to 1,185.2, a 2.2 percent increase from a week ago.
"I think shares will continue rising in the next year pushed up by expected listings of newly privatised firms," Milos Obed, a trader at "A" bank said.
Turnover eased to 316.4 million tolars from 337.2 million tolars. Overall 12 shares rose and three fell, while another 10 were untraded.
Preferred shares of Hipotekarna banka Brezice was the most actively traded stock, firming 5.37 percent to 4,530 tolars on volume of 20,265 shares.
Financial consultancy Primofin was the biggest gainer, jumping 12.66 percent to 21,980 tolars on volume of 32 shares.
Ordinary shares of Dolenjska banka was the leading decliner, easing 0.99 percent to 11,970 tolars on volume of 100 shares.
